meta.name: description
meta.content: Sarasota County Schools is a public school district serving all of Sarasota County, Florida. The School District of Sarasota County prepares students to achieve the highest learning standards by engaging a high-quality staff, involved parents, and a supportive community.

meta.name: author

$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: We support all children in pursuit of their academic, athletic and artistic endeavors and work hard to ensure our students graduate on time, are college and career ready and prepared for success in a global society. Every Student. Every Day.

img.alt: Sarasota County Schools' logo

a.span: April 18 – A Brief Update from Sarasota County Schools

div.p: April 18, 2020 - Please note the following information from Sarasota County Schools.

a.title: Go to comments for April 18 – A Brief Update from Sarasota County Schools

img.alt: Kids grouped together, excited for school

a.span: New Student Registration and Existing Student Re-Registration for the 2020-21 School Year

div.p: SARASOTA COUNTY, April 15, 2020 – Sarasota County Schools is encouraging all parents and guardians to begin registering first-time students, as well as re-register existing students, for the upcoming school year.

a.title: Go to comments for New Student Registration and Existing Student Re-Registration for the 2020-21 School Year

img.alt: Sarasota County Schools' logo

a.span: Important Information – School Board Work Session & Meeting on April 21

div.p: SARASOTA COUNTY, April 14, 2020 – The School Board of Sarasota County, Florida gives notice that it will conduct a work session and a meeting using telephonic conferencing technology on April 21, 2010 at 12:00 PM and3:00 PM.

a.title: Go to comments for Important Information – School Board Work Session & Meeting on April 21

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: Booker High VPA: Ringling Collaboration has Lasting Effects in “Legacy.Left.”

a.span: Booker High VPA: Ringling Collaboration has Lasting Effects in “Legacy.Left.”

div.p: SARASOTA COUNTY, March 4, 2020 – Booker High School’s VPA Dance department will dig into the past to present its upcoming showcase, “Legacy.Left.” at 7:00 PM, March 6 & 7 in the VPA Theatre. One of the pieces embraces the John and Mable Ringling legacy, a cornerstone of Sarasota’s heritage.

a.title: Go to comments for Booker High VPA: Ringling Collaboration has Lasting Effects in “Legacy.Left.”

img.alt: Close-up of a young boy's hands holding a tablet, scrolling

a.span: How to Protect Your Child in an Increasingly Digital Age

div.p: Advice from a school-based mental health therapist on protecting children in the digital age.

a.title: Go to comments for How to Protect Your Child in an Increasingly Digital Age

img.alt: Booker Middle drama students rehearsing

a.span: Booker Middle Drama Students Bring History to Life for a Younger Generation

div.p: SARASOTA COUNTY, February 21, 2020 – Booker Middle School’s Visual & Performing Arts program is partnering with Gulf Gate Elementary School to bring history to life through arts integration.

a.title: Go to comments for Booker Middle Drama Students Bring History to Life for a Younger Generation

img.alt: Governor Ron DeSantis' letterhead

a.span: First Lady Casey DeSantis Releases Guidelines for “The Facts. Your Future.” Video Competition

div.p: $34,000 in cash prizes available for students and schools for winning videos highlighting substance abuse prevention

a.title: Go to comments for First Lady Casey DeSantis Releases Guidelines for “The Facts. Your Future.” Video Competition

img.alt: Booker High JROTC to Host Marker Placement Ceremony at Oaklands-Woodlawn Cemetery – February 19

a.span: Booker High JROTC to Host Marker Placement Ceremony at Oaklands-Woodlawn Cemetery – February 19

div.p: SARASOTA COUNTY, February 11, 2020 – Booker High School’s Junior Reserve Officers’ Training Corps (JROTC) program will host a marker placement ceremony at the Oaklands-Woodlawn Cemetery for African-Americans (1037 Gillespie Ave, Sarasota, FL 34236) at 10:00 AM on Wednesday, February 19. The event will pay tribute to veterans and community members who are buried there.

a.title: Go to comments for Booker High JROTC to Host Marker Placement Ceremony at Oaklands-Woodlawn Cemetery – February 19

img.alt: Artistic photo of a crown on a pillow, a student actor is partially shown in the background

a.span: Booker High VPA Theatre Students to Present Shakespeare’s “Macbeth” – February 20-22

div.p: SARASOTA COUNTY, February 11, 2020 – Booker High School’s Visual and Performing Arts (VPA) theatre department will present William Shakespeare’s “Macbeth” during three 7:00 PM shows from Thursday, February 20— Saturday, February 22 in the VPA theatre. The productions will be directed by Sunny Smith.

a.title: Go to comments for Booker High VPA Theatre Students to Present Shakespeare’s “Macbeth” – February 20-22

img.alt: Sarasota Middle Joyful Voices choir

a.span: Sarasota Middle School’s "Joyful Voices" on Their Way to Nashville

div.p: SARASOTA COUNTY, February 5, 2020 – On February 13-17, students in Sarasota Middle School’s (SMS) "Joyful Voices" choir, under the direction of Nadia Sawa, will be travelling to perform in Nashville, TN, also affectionately known as "Music City, U.S.A.”. This is the first time the SMS choir will be travelling out of state to perform.

a.title: Go to comments for Sarasota Middle School’s "Joyful Voices" on Their Way to Nashville

img.alt: Close-up, artistic photo of a professional video camera

a.span: Booker High Students to Adapt Stephen King’s “The Last Rung on the Ladder” Into Film

div.p: Students enrolled in Booker High School’s Visual and Performing Arts (VPA) Film & Animation program will soon be adapting best-selling author Stephen King’s short story “The Last Rung on the Ladder” into a film.

a.title: Go to comments for Booker High Students to Adapt Stephen King’s “The Last Rung on the Ladder” Into Film

img.alt: Pine View chorus students at Disney's Magic Kingdom

a.span: Pine View School’s High School Choral Program Hits All the Right Notes

div.p: SARASOTA COUNTY, December 17. 2019 – Pine View School’s high school choral program has had a remarkable first half of the 2019-20 school year. From prestigious performances to rigorous competitions, these students have impressed audiences near and far with their undeniable musicality!

a.title: Go to comments for Pine View School’s High School Choral Program Hits All the Right Notes

a.span: Prague Youth Film Festival to Showcase Booker High Students’ “Into the Storm”

div.p: SARASOTA COUNTY, December 13, 2019 – Booker High School’s acclaimed student-made documentary —“Into the Storm”— was selected to appear in the Prague Youth Film Festival, where it will be seen and adjudicated by industry professionals from around the globe

a.title: Go to comments for Prague Youth Film Festival to Showcase Booker High Students’ “Into the Storm”

img.alt: Dancers from the Sarasota High theatre group

a.span: Behind the Curtain of Sarasota High School Theatre’s “White Christmas”

div.p: SARASOTA COUNTY, December 10, 2019 – From December 11 to December 14, Sarasota High School will be hosting performances of “White Christmas”. With show stopping numbers, a bit of romance, some mischief, and a lot of heart, this is the musical we have all been dreaming of!

a.title: Go to comments for Behind the Curtain of Sarasota High School Theatre’s “White Christmas”

img.alt: Cast members from Tuck Everlasting

a.span: Booker High School to Showcase “Tuck Everlasting”

div.p: SARASOTA COUNTY, December 10, 2019 – The award-winning Booker High School Visual & Performing Arts (VPA) Theatre department will present the area premiere of “Tuck Everlasting”, a musical based on the cherished children’s novel by Natalie Babbitt.

a.title: Go to comments for Booker High School to Showcase “Tuck Everlasting”

img.alt: Scrabble letters that spell out Mental Health

a.span: How School-Based Therapy is Destigmatizing Mental Health

div.p: “My family thinks I’m crazy … is there something wrong with me?”. This is a phrase I’m used to hearing when I take on a new client.

a.title: Go to comments for How School-Based Therapy is Destigmatizing Mental Health

img.alt: Booker Middle School Teacher Recognized by CFES Brilliant Pathways for Preparing Students for College and Careers

a.span: Booker Middle School Teacher Recognized by CFES Brilliant Pathways for Preparing Students for College and Careers

div.p: SARASOTA COUNTY, November 8, 2019 – When Booker Middle School Principal Dr. LaShawn Frost asked Haley Shaffer to become a CFES Brilliant Pathways liaison, she knew the social studies teacher would take the award-winning program to even greater heights.

a.title: Go to comments for Booker Middle School Teacher Recognized by CFES Brilliant Pathways for Preparing Students for College and Careers

img.alt: Colton and an Atwater Elementary teacher sitting at a table with books

a.span: Reading Recovery Initiative in Sarasota County Schools Outperforms National Average for Third Consecutive Year

div.p: SARASOTA COUNTY, November 4, 2019 – The results are in: Reading Recovery in Sarasota County Schools has outpaced the national average of success for this widely implemented literacy intervention for the third year in a row.

a.title: Go to comments for Reading Recovery Initiative in Sarasota County Schools Outperforms National Average for Third Consecutive Year

img.alt: A women wearing a mask giving Halloween candy to a little girl in a costume

a.span: Safe Trick-or-Treating Tips Every Parent Should Know

div.p: SARASOTA COUNTY, October 25, 2019 – As a school-based mental health therapist and the mother of two teenagers, I have put a lot of thought into Halloween and trick-or-treating safety over the years.

a.title: Go to comments for Safe Trick-or-Treating Tips Every Parent Should Know

img.alt: Attendance Works logo, hand holding an apple

a.span: Record-breaking 803 Superintendents Pledge to Prioritize Attendance in 2019-20 School Year

div.p: Sarasota County Schools contributes to record-breaking pledge to prioritize attendance.

a.title: Go to comments for Record-breaking 803 Superintendents Pledge to Prioritize Attendance in 2019-20 School Year

img.alt: Head shot of Dr. Laura Kingsley

a.span: Social and Emotional Learning (SEL) is All Day, Every Day

div.p: Monday mornings get a bad rap, and they get even worse when national headlines such as “UN Meeting Reveals a World in a Really Bad Mood” flood our minds. Negative headlines such as this set the tone for the entire day, and if you are like me, you may wonder if you took one deep breath throughout the day... Read more to learn about Sarasota County Schools' approach to Social and Emotional Learning (SEL).

a.title: Go to comments for Social and Emotional Learning (SEL) is All Day, Every Day

img.alt: Two students reading a magic book with a third student looking on, holding an ornate scepter

a.span: Booker High School VPA Theatre to Open Season with Rough Magic

div.p: The Booker High School VPA theatre department will present Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa’s “Rough Magic” as the VPA season opener.

a.title: Go to comments for Booker High School VPA Theatre to Open Season with Rough Magic

img.alt: Group photo of the students: Janeth Rivas-Castillo, Tallulah Bonifield, Maren Timpe, Matthew Abolaf

a.span: Booker High School Students Collaborate with Award-winning Children’s Author

div.p: Award-winning children’s book author Ethan Long will collaborate with students from the Booker High School Visual & Performing Arts (VPA) Film & Animation department to create an animation for his story “Empty Nest”.

a.title: Go to comments for Booker High School Students Collaborate with Award-winning Children’s Author

img.alt: Forty Carrots employees sitting in one of their playrooms with children seated around them

a.span: Forty Carrots Family Center – Celebrating 25 Years of Serving Sarasota County

div.p: Since 1993, more than 40,000 families from all walks of life have been strengthened through Forty Carrots’ programs and services, which can mitigate the negative effects of toxic stress, poverty, abuse and other adverse environments.

a.title: Go to comments for Forty Carrots Family Center – Celebrating 25 Years of Serving Sarasota County

img.alt: Kaleidoscope of Creativity wording surround by multi-colored dots

a.span: Booker High School’s Kaleidoscope of Creativity Program Awards $16,000 in Scholarships

div.p: SARASOTA COUNTY – This past school year, several students in the Booker High School Visual & Performing Arts Program were awarded scholarship money to provide funding relief for enrollment in summer pre-college or collegiate programs in the arts.

a.title: Go to comments for Booker High School’s Kaleidoscope of Creativity Program Awards $16,000 in Scholarships

img.alt: Left to right, Jesse Lazarus, Allison Hamley, Kirk Hutchinson & Jane Mendola

a.span: Allison Hamley Named 2019 Venice-Nokomis Rotary Teacher of the Year

div.p: Learn more about the amazing Venice Elementary teacher that received the 2019 Teacher of the Year award from the Venice-Nokomis Rotary Club

a.title: Go to comments for Allison Hamley Named 2019 Venice-Nokomis Rotary Teacher of the Year

img.alt: Family Members ‘Major’ in Mental Health at Parent University

a.span: Family Members ‘Major’ in Mental Health at Parent University

div.p: The Florida Center for Early Childhood’s team of school-based mental health therapists took on new a role this summer – they served as “professors” at Parent Universities across the county.

a.title: Go to comments for Family Members ‘Major’ in Mental Health at Parent University

img.alt: Teacher reading with his students, all are sitting in a row, each with a book

a.span: Commissioner Corcoran Releases New Back-to-School Reading List

div.p: Read all about Commissioner Corcoran's new Back-to-School Reading List

a.title: Go to comments for Commissioner Corcoran Releases New Back-to-School Reading List

img.alt: A clear light bulb resting on top of chalkboard. There is an idea cloud drawn around the light bulb

img.alt: Meet Record-Breaking 10-Year-Old Playwright, Viviana

div.p: Viviana is a normal fifth grader. Her favorite colors are robin’s egg blue and sea foam green. In her spare time, she enjoys reading Harry Potter and playing with her dog, Millie. She also really likes watching random videos on YouTube.

a.title: Go to comments for Meet Record-Breaking 10-Year-Old Playwright, Viviana

a.span: Pine View’s Claire Critchett Wins Florida Governor’s Black History Month Essay Contest

div.p: The following award-winning essay was written by Claire Critchett. Claire was the only middle school student in the state of Florida to win this essay contest. She received a four-year Florida College Plan scholarship provided by Florida Prepaid College Foundation.

div.p: Fax:

div.span: If you see something on our website that is out of date please contact us. Under Florida law, email addresses are public records. If you do not want your email address released in response to a public records request, do not send electronic mail to this entity. Instead, contact this office by phone or in writing.
